question: A.03 (1.0 points) {3.0} Which ONE of the following IS CORRECT with regard to criticality?

answers.answer: a. Critical rod height does NOT depend on how fast control rods are withdrawn.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: Pulstar Reactor Trainee Notebook, Chapter 1, 1.5.3, p. 19.

answers.answer: b. Critical rod height dictates the reactor power level when criticality is first achieved.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Pulstar Reactor Trainee Notebook, Chapter 1, 1.5.3, p. 19.

answers.answer: c. The reactivity of the reactor increases towards infinity during the approach to criticality.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Pulstar Reactor Trainee Notebook, Chapter 1, 1.5.3, p. 19.

answers.answer: d. The slower the approach to criticality, the lower the reactor power level will be when reaching criticality.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Pulstar Reactor Trainee Notebook, Chapter 1, 1.5.3, p. 19.

question: A.04 (1.0 points) {4.0} The delayed neutron fraction (β) for U-235 is 0.0065. However, you note that while performing various calculations at the reactor, the value for the effective delayed neutron fraction (βeff) has a value of ≈0.007. Which of the following is most likely the reason for why βeff is larger than β?

answers.answer: a. Delayed Neutrons are born at higher energies than prompt neutrons resulting in a greater worth for the neutrons.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Reactor Theory (Neutron Characteristics) DOE-HDBK-1019/1-93

answers.answer: b. Delayed Neutrons are born at lower energies than prompt neutrons resulting in less leakage during slowdown to thermal energies.
answers.feedback: Correct. Reference: Reactor Theory (Neutron Characteristics) DOE-HDBK-1019/1-93

answers.answer: c. The fuel also contains U-238 which has a relatively cross section of absorption during fast fission.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Reactor Theory (Neutron Characteristics) DOE-HDBK-1019/1-93

answers.answer: d. U-238 in the core becomes Pu-239 (by neutron absorption), which has a higher beta for fission.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. Reference: Reactor Theory (Neutron Characteristics) DOE-HDBK-1019/1-93

question: A.17 (1.0 points) {17.0} Two different neutron sources were used during two reactor startups. answers.answer: b. The concentration of Xe-135 reaches a maximum value 40 hours after the down power transient and will decrease to a new, higher equilibrium value until it reaches a maximum value equilibrium

answers.answer: c. The insertion of control rods displaces the axial reactor flux causing an increased production rate of xenon gas until it reaches a maximum value 7-8 hours after the down power transient.

answers.answer: d. The decay rate of fission product, Cesium-135 increases due to the down power transient which increases the concentration of Xe-135 to a maximum value 40 hours later.
